chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Traveon M Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 5 years bifurcated sentence.  Eligible for CIP and SAP only after serving 50% of the confinement time.
Concurrent with: 21CF510.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  No contact with mother unless approved by agent. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Extended supervision can be transferred to Alabama if Alabama accepts.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If unpaid, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment. To be paid over the course of supervision on Ct. 5 and case 21CF510. To be collected by DOC.

9:17 AM Defendant Traveon M Martin in court, in custody.  Attorney Laura Ann Walker Esq in court for Traveon M Martin.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Saige Smith.  There is a PSI on file.  The court has questions regarding statements made to the PSI writer before moving forward.  Defense is prepared to go forward.  The court also has questions regarding the PSI writer's recommendation as to the mandatory minimum on the firearm enhancer.  The mandatory minimum firearm enhancer has sunsetted since the time of the plea hearing.  Court performs colloquy with the defendant.  It is the defendant's decision to move forward today.  Parties have reviewed the PSI and make no additions or corrections.  Parties make sentencing arguments.  Defendant speaks on his own behalf. 

BTC:
21CF510:
Ct. 1- 3 yr. WPS, 18 mo. IC and 18 mo. ES.
Ct. 2- 8 yr. WPS, 4 yr. IC and 4 yr. ES.  Concurrent to Ct. 1.
22CF152:
Ct. 5- 5 yr WPS, 3 yr. IC and 2 yr. ES.  Concurrent to 21CF510.
Ct. 6- 12 mo. RCJ, Court Costs, DNA Sample and Surcharge.  Consecutive to Ct. 5 and 21CF510. 

Eligible for CIP and SAP only after serving 50% of the confinement time.  

Supervision may be transferred to the State of Alabama if Alabama accepts. 

Conditions:
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent.
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
No contact with mother unless approved by agent. 
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge. 
FAW/Vote.
8-30 adj. off the record per defense scheduling conflict and letter filed.
Sentencing hearing on October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
for an adj.

Court Reporter:  Carmen Howard.  State files an amended complaint.   Upon plea to 21CF510, Ct. 1 and Ct. 2,  4 yr IC and 3 yr. ES on Ct. 2, 18 mo. IC and 18 mo. ES, on Ct. 2.   22CF152, Ct. 5, 18 mo. IC and 18 mo. ES, i/s, 2 yr. probation and Ct. 6 the State would recommend concurrent probation, 20CF962, State is in Chapter 950,  to be dismissed outright based on the request of the victim. 8:42 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Traveon M Martin appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Laura Ann Walker Esq appeared in court for Traveon M Martin. 9:12 AM Prosecuting attorney Jessica Lynott appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Traveon M Martin appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Laura Ann Walker Esq appeared in court for Traveon M Martin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Preliminary hearing waived, probable cause found, bound over. 
Defense moves to modify bond.
State obj.
BTC: Motion to modify bond denied.
Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on March 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with L.H (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
